It took some manual QA (disabling every extension one-by-one, testing, re-enabling), but I figured out this extension was causing **ChatGPT** (https://chat.openai.com/) to freeze when uploading one or more images/screenshots. Fortunately, you can configure the extension to not load on specific websites, which solved the issue for me.

Hope this helps someone else!

Name is grossly misleading. It's not zooming, it just shows the image in real size. Zoom means 101% or more. On a site that has small 100% images, this is useless.

Now all you have to do save the zoomed images is  to re-enable it on settings.

Just go to the extension option page, click on the "Advanced" tab, and enable the first option "Allow downloading images using an action key".

This extension is one of about 6 that I deem must haves. When I'm not utilizing VMs to provide a sort of poor-man's sandbox for my activities, the next best solution is utilizing many browsers and segmenting your day to day activity; banking = browser A. I've been using this for months, but I recently noticed that when accessing Amazon, i was constantly being redirected to a deals page, always with an amazon affiliates tag now in the site URL (guitacom20) -- I basically disabled my extensions one by one, and worked out that when this extension was disabled, I no longer suffered the problem.

So I don't conclusively know whether this extension contains malware, but it seems possible for sure and I will no longer be using it.

I've been going back and forth between Imagus and Hover Zoom+. These are two extensions that do pretty much the same thing. But they have differences between them and after the comparison I've compiled a list of differences between the two that will hopefully help you make your decision on which one you want to keep. Here they are:


Imagus

PROS
* Nice caption design
* Image/video size in caption
* Captions the links correctly - example Instagram, shows not the title of the link, but the act... Show more

This extension is a miracle! I can't believe I've been surfing the web for years without such a simple but life changing tool.

This extension hijacked my browser-- I never consented to having spyware on my computer, obviously. 

It just took me over 2 hours to figure out which extension in Chrome was messing with my default browser. Sure, it's nice to zoom in on photos if you are blind as a bat like I am, but it is not worth it. Really freaks me out....

I like looking at big pictures and I hate having to click into pages to see them! This is an unexpectedly useful extension. I only wish more websites were supported. Also, it's open source, so if I was smart enough, I could add that kind of support. 5/5 stars!

I am not an extension collector, for all sort of reasons, and I can tell you this is one the four extensions I allow in my browser. Really neat UX trick, that should be a default in all browsers (Opera are you listening?), and really good implementation.

This was an incredibly useful extension but unfortunately it now needs access to manage my downloads which is something I am unwilling to give. Apparently it is to fix the download feature which I did not find useful at all. Very unfortunate.

This is open source, that means safe.
Maybe a upgrade note would be better.

If you want the extension to download images, then it needs access to "manage downloads", and if you want it to zoom an image, then it needs access to "data on webpages", it's that easy. Guess all the 1star givers here are morons ;-)
Thanks for you good work!
